the 
incident  to  Multanabai  and  then  went  in  search  of her  husband,  a
rickshaw puller.  After narrating  the  incident  to  him,  both  of them  went to
the police station and lodged the  complaint,  Exhibit  P.l,  at about 4.10 p.m.
It was said that there was considerable delay and sufficient time for tutoring
and therefore  her evidence could not be  belivered  There  is  no  merit in  this
contention.  The  submission overlooks  the fact that in India women are slow
and hesitant to  complain of such assaults and if the prosecutrix happens  to

be  a  married  person  she  will  not  do  anything  without 
informing  her

husband  Merely  because  the  complaint  was  lodged  less 
than  promptly
does  not raise  the inference  that the  complaint was false.  The  reluctance
to  go to  the police is  because of society's attitude towards such  women;  it
